items.description: Rivers Otter and Sid, and Exmouth Area
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible on Sunday afternoon. Over the last 12 hours we have seen heavy rainfall in the Rivers Otter, Sid and Exmouth area. This has meant that the rivers are now rising and will remain very sensitive to further rainfall. Levels suggest that there will be flooding to low lying land and roads close to the rivers. 

We expect the rivers to remain high throughout today though no flooding to properties is forecast and warnings are not expected to be issued. Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions. 

We are constantly monitoring river levels and have staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages in this location. This message will be updated on Monday morning or earlier if the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Asker, River Brit, River Bride, River Char, River Lim

items.message:
River levels have risen at the Bridport Gundry river level gauge as a result of persistent heavy rainfall.  Consequently, the risk of flooding has risen. 
We expect flooding to affect the Rivers Simene, Brit and Asker.   
Further showery, sometimes heavy, rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high until Monday morning.
We are closely monitoring the situation.   Our incident response staff are checking defences.  
Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded and refer to local authority website for local road closures.  
This message will be updated by 12:00 on Monday, 17/5/2021, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Horner Water, River Aller, Washford River, Hawkcombe Stream, Monksilver Stream, Doniford Stream

items.message: River levels remain high at the Beggearn Huish river gauge. Further showery rainfall is forecast today, 16/05/21, and so the flood alert remains in force.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible today. Areas most at risk are the Horner Water, Rivers Aller and Washford, and the Hawkcombe, Monksilver and Doniford Streams and tributaries. We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are checking defences and clearing weed screens.  Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded and refer to local authority website for local road closures.  Visit the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast. This message will be updated on Monday 17/05/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Rivers Clyst and Culm and their tributaries
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible on Sunday afternoon. Over the last 12 hours we have seen heavy rainfall in the Rivers Clyst and Culm areas. This has meant that the rivers in these areas are now rising and will remain very sensitive to further rainfall. Levels suggest that there will be flooding to low lying land and roads close to the rivers. 

We expect the rivers to remain high on Sunday afternoon and overnight to Monday morning though no flooding to properties is forecast and warnings are not expected to be issued. Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions. 

We are constantly monitoring river levels and have staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages in this location. This message will be updated on Monday morning or earlier if the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Teign, River Bovey, River Lemon, River Kenn

items.message:
Flooding is possible on Sunday afternoon and evening. Over the last 12 hours we have seen heavy rainfall in the River Teign area. This has meant that the Rivers Teign and Bovey are now rising. Levels suggest that there will be flooding to low lying land and cycle paths, footpaths and roads close to the river, including Teigngrace Road and Summer Lane. 
We expect the rivers to remain high on Sunday evening though no flooding to properties is forecast and warnings are not expected to be issued. Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions. 
We are constantly monitoring river levels and have staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages in this location. This message will be updated on Monday morning or earlier if the situation changes.

This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.  Isolated patches of heavy rainfall are possible today and into next week.

items.description: Upper River Great Ouse in Northamptonshire, Oxfordshire and Buckinghamshire
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.  Isolated patches of heavy rainfall are possible today and into next week.

items.description: River Ray and its tributaries from Shipton Lee to and including Islip

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Ray, Wootten Brook, Doddershall Brook, Tetchwick Brook, Lugershall Brook, Murswell Hill Brook, Cutters Brook, Piddington Brook, Blackthorn Brook, Panshill Brook, Studley Wood Brook, Beckley Brook, Oddington Brook, Gallos Brook, Chipping Farm Stream

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels remain high but steady on the River Ray as a result of previous heavy rainfall. Therefore, flooding of roads and farmland is possible, especially in the Islip area. 
The forecast today is for isolated rainfall showers, which may be heavy at times. 
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are in the area clearing weed/trash screens. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated this evening, 16/05/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Cherwell from Lower Heyford down to and including Oxford

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Cherwell, Woodeaton Brook, Bayswater Brook, Marston Brook, Peasmoor Brook

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed. 
River levels have peaked and will remain steady, with no further rise forecasted. There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. Further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours. 
We continue to monitor the situation. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels.

items.description: South East Somerset Rivers, Upper Reaches

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Yeo, River Cam, River Wriggle, Barwick Stream, West Coker Stream

items.message: River levels are rising at the Sherborne Lake river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible today, 16/05/21. Areas most at risk are the Sparkford to Weston Bampfylde road and Deep Ford Lane, Chetnole. We are monitoring the situation constantly. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded and refer to local authority website for local road closures.  Our incident response staff are clearing weed screens. Please see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast. This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 17/05/21, or as the situation changes.
